trans-unit.source: Provides access to an ordered, strongly typed collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition"></xref> objects.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition"></xref> element to a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition"></xref> to add to the collection.
Clears the content of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection"></xref>.
Determines whether a given <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition"></xref> exists within a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition"></xref> that is being tested.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition"></xref> exists within the collection; otherwise `false`.
Copies an array of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition"></xref> objects to a given index position within a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection"></xref>.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection> uses a zero-based indexing system.
An array of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition"></xref> objects.
Identifies the index position within array to which the objects are copied.
array is `null`.
array is multidimensional.
-or-
The number of elements in the source is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination array.
index is less than zero.
Gets the total number of items within this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection"></xref>.
The total number of items in the collection.
This property has no default value.
Returns the index position of a given <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition"></xref> within a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition"></xref> whose index position is desired.
The index of value if found in the collection; otherwise, -1.
Inserts a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition"></xref> at the specified index position within a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection"></xref>.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection> uses a zero-based indexing system.
The position within the collection where the item is inserted.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition"></xref> to insert.
index is not a valid index in the .
Gets a value that indicates whether a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection"></xref> is read-only.
`true` if the collection is read-only; otherwise `false`.
This property has no default value.
Gets a value that indicates whether access to this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection"></xref> is synchronized (thread safe).
Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure.
Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception.
To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions that result from changes made by other threads.
`true` if access to this collection is synchronized; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates the current item within a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection"></xref>.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection> uses a zero-based indexing system.
The current item in the collection.
The element at the specified index.
index is not a valid index position in the collection.
Removes a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition"></xref> from a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition"></xref> to remove from the collection.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition"></xref> was found in the collection and removed; otherwise, `false`.
Removes a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition"></xref> from a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection"></xref> at the specified index position.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection> uses a zero-based indexing system.
The position within the collection at which the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition"></xref> is removed.
Removes a range of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition"></xref> objects from a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection"></xref>.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection> uses a zero-based indexing system.
The position within the collection at which the first <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition"></xref> is removed.
The total number of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition"></xref> objects to remove from the collection.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection"></xref>.
Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure.
Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception.
To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions that result from changes made by other threads.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1.GetEnumerator"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> interface.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1"></xref> object that can be used to iterate through the collection.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo(System.Array,System.Int32)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
A zero-based <xref href="System.Array"></xref> that receives the copied items from the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection"></xref>.
The first position in the specified <xref href="System.Array"></xref> to receive the copied contents.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerable.GetEnumerator"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> object that can be used to iterate through the collection.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Add(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to add to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection"></xref>.
The position into which the new element was inserted.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Contains(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection"></xref>.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Object"></xref> is found in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.IndexOf(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection"></xref>.
The index of value if found in the list; otherwise, -1.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Insert(System.Int32,System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The zero-based index at which to insert the <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to insert into the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.IsFixedSize"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
`true` if the the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection"></xref> has a fixed size; otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Item(System.Int32)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
This property provides the ability to access a specific element in the collection by using the following syntax: `myCollection[index]`.
The zero-based index of the element to get or set.
The element at the specified index.
index is not a valid index position in the list.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Remove(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to remove from the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection"></xref>.
